name: first_time
label: Welcome to Precision Sustainable Agriculture Data Collection form for Cover Crop Biomass Harvest and Decomposition Bags
hint: Is this your first time collecting biomass on-farm?

name: biomass_video
label: Watch this short video about On-Farm Biomass

name: url_widget
label: Use this link for more information

name: field_info
label: First we need a little information about your field

name: farm_code
label: What is the Farm Code?
hint: These 3 letter codes were selected for you when you enrolled a farm

name: gps_site
label: Select a single GPS point to represent this farm
hint: (will be the point used for mapping locations and weather data)

name: termination_data_you
label: Do you know the termination date of this cover crop?

name: termination_date
label: Termination Date

name: Field_diagram
label: Walk around your field, surveying the cover crop. While you are walking we will take GPS points around the perimeter of the whole Cover Crop and Bare Treatment areas

name: gps_cc_001
label: Record each of the 4 corners of the Cover Crop Treatment

name: gps_cc_002
label: Record each of the 4 corners of the Cover Crop Treatment

name: gps_cc_003
label: Record each of the 4 corners of the Cover Crop Treatment

name: gps_cc_004
label: Record each of the 4 corners of the Cover Crop Treatment

name: gps_bare_001
label: Record each of the 4 corners of the Bare Ground Treatment

name: gps_bare_002
label: Record each of the 4 corners of the Bare Ground Treatment

name: gps_bare_003
label: Record each of the 4 corners of the Bare Ground Treatment

name: gps_bare_004
label: Record each of the 4 corners of the Bare Ground Treatment

name: measure
label: Next we want to help you accurately measure 1 meter square harvest areas for cover crop biomass.

name: drilled_broad
label: Was the cover crop planted with a drill or broadcast?

name: drill_spacing
label: If drilled, what is the drill line spacing in inches?

name: That_is_drill_spaci_in_centimeters_right
label: That is ${drill_spacing_cm} in centimeters right?

name: harvest_length
guidance_hint: This is how long you will harvest 6 drill lines

name: To_equal_1_meter_squ_ch_harvest_length
label: To equal 1 meter square area in THIS field: You will harvest 6 drill lines, for this many centimeters each:  ${harvest_length}
hint: Select 6 representative drill lines in your subplot.

name: Next_take_2_extra_l_g_tools_to_Subplot_1
label: Next take  2 extra large plastic bags, measuring device, and cutting tools to Subplot 1

name: Your_field_is_Broadc_r_a_pre_made_quadrat
label: Your field is Broadcast:  You will harvest one meter square area 100 cm x 100 cm, by using meter sticks, or a pre-made quadrat.

name: Next_take_2_extra_la_g_tools_to_Subplot_1
label: Next take 2 extra large plastic bags, a meter square measuring device, and cutting tools to Subplot 1
hint: You will harvest 2 sub-samples (we will call them A and B) inside each subplot.

name: sub1_Legume
label: Look around in your Subplot.  It is roughly 30 m x 30 m area.  Is the cover crop stand made up of more or less than 40% legume?

name: fresh_wt_a1
label: What is the Fresh Wt of Subsample A (fresh biomass/ m2 including the bag) in grams?

name: fresh_wt_b1
label: What is the Fresh Wt of Subsample B (fresh biomass/ m2 including the bag) in grams?

name: Next_pour_the_conten_em_into_the_tote_too
label: Next pour the contents of both Subsample A and B into one large container or tote. There are 2 meters inside.  Mix them all together.  Walk back into the field, and clip extra handfuls of cover crop and throw them into the tote too.

name: bag_a
label: What is the weight of empty bag A (in grams)?

name: bag_b
label: What is the weight of empty bag B (in grams)?

name: This_is_the_average_h_wt_grams_correct
label: This is the average fresh weight of your Subplot 1, ${sub1_average_fresh_wt} grams, correct?

name: target
label: Next we divide that weight by 6, to get the target fresh weight for each of the 12 decomp bags in that subplot.  Your target fresh weight (in grams) per each decomp bag in THIS subplot is:: ${target1_bag_wt}

name: Target_weight_target1_bag_wt
label: Target weight:  ${target1_bag_wt}

name: Fill_12_bags_10_mes_s_and_B_s_T0_to_T5
label: Fill 12 bags (10 mesh and 2 paper) for subplot 1 (A’s and B’s) T0 to T5.

name: dry_wt_group
label: Decomp Bag Fresh Subplot1  Rows A and B Target weight:  ${target1_bag_wt}

name: decomp_bag
label: Use the camera to scan a barcode

name: dry_wt
label: Total Fresh Wt (grams)

name: dry_wt_group_001
label: Decomp Bag Fresh Subplot1  Rows A and B Target weight:  ${target1_bag_wt}

name: decomp_bag_001
label: Use the camera to scan a barcode

name: dry_wt_001
label: Total Fresh Wt (grams)

name: end_sub1
label: You have finished with Subplot 1. Continue the same process for Subplot 2.  Place 2 paperbags from Subplot 1 in the truck and we will return to the mesh bags later.

name: sub2
label: Begin Subplot 2

name: end_sub2
label: You have finished with Subplot 2. You will bring 4 paper bags back to the lab to dry at 60C. The 20 remaining mesh decomp bags should be placed in the field, if planted with cash crop, or at the field edge until crop rows are in place.
